title: Dumbest interaction in League
body:
If you're playing as Sivir and spell shield Soraka's Q, she still heals. That literally makes no sense.

Rito pls

Soraka's Q doesn't actually require a damage component. This isn't an FAQ or anything, but this is just how it's scripted on the backend. Her Q makes no check to determine whether damage is dealt before adjudicating her health bonus. All it's checking is whether or not a champion was hit.

Yeah, but this post isn't really asking why it does it. This post is saying that it's completely illogical and should be changed. If you block a Lee Sin Q, he can't dash to you. If you block a Nid spear, her thingy doesn't trigger.
Yeah, but those are actually applying debuffs when they do it, which spellshields block. Soraka's heal doesn't apply any debuffs and, as I said before, the heal has no damage requirement.
Most spellshields negate every effect related to a spell, not only debuffs.

No, that's not actually true. Spellshields negate any aspect of a spell that affects the champion using the spellshield. They don't prevent beneficial effects that only buff the champion who used the spell.

For example, if one of Ezreal's abilities gets spellshielded, he'll still get his attack speed and CDR for hitting his abilities. Other abilities that grant reduced cooldowns when they hit will also generally reduce the cooldowns as if they had not hit a spellshield (Ezreal is an example of this, and I'm fairly certain Fiora is too). Veigar still gets his AP for hitting an ability.

Ezreal' s on spell hit, not spell effect applied. It means that even if it pops the shield ther eis still damage done ( the shield that popped). The as steroid comes out of an external source than the spell itself, and maybe this is the same case as soraka because if i remember correctly initially she got her heal from q as a part of W, which is the same case as ezreal only more compact.

This said, Darien down here is alright about Cait' s traps. But it is also true that spells like Trundle' s Chomp (Q) get noth the spell and the buff negated.
It seems they are pretty much inconsistent.
Thiiiiiis. If you remove Soraka getting healing there are soooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo many other interactions that would have to be changed as well.

Slow is a debuff. But as I said, this post isn't asking why it does. It's pointing out that it's stupid that it does. You block her spell, yet she still gets the heal for "hitting" it. Doesn't make any sense.

Think about it like this: Spell shields prevent negative effects to the person who used the ability. They don't prevent beneficial effects for the person who used the ability. If you think about it like that, then almost all spellshield interactions will make sense. 

Examples: Lee and Nidalee apply a negative effect to the enemy by being able to jump to them, so that part gets blocked. Soraka's heal is solely beneficial to herself and puts no negative effect on the enemy, so she still gets it, just like how Veigar still gets his AP, Ezreal still gets his attack speed, etc.
